content:
• Wednesday, April 3, 2013
  • MHVYF

    Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (OTCPK:MHVYF +1%) bucks the weakness in Japanese markets after...

    Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (OTCPK:MHVYF +1%) bucks the weakness in Japanese markets after winning a $22B Turkish nuclear-power-plant contract along with France's Areva (OTCPK:ARVCY). The team will build four Atmea1-type pressurized water reactors with a combined output of 4.5M kilowatts. Construction is to begin in 2017, with the first reactor coming on line by 2023.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 PM
  • IPCI

    More on Intellipharmaceutics (NASDAQ:IPCI): FQ1 beats on a per share basis as losses were less...

    More on Intellipharmaceutics (NASDAQ:IPCI): FQ1 beats on a per share basis as losses were less than expected, largely due to lower overall expenses in R&D and SG&A. The company did not provide revenue figures in its release. Shares -1.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it is withholding additional payments related to its purchase of the...

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it is withholding additional payments related to its purchase of the troubled Simandou iron ore project in Guinea and intends to "vigorously defend" itself if JV partner BSG Resources presses for more money. The dispute adds a new wrinkle to Vale's saga at Simandou, where work has been suspended due to regulatory uncertainties that could affect the project. VALE +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • CCG

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CCG +8%. ANV +5%. AVEO +4%. GFI +3%. VALE +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CCG +8%. ANV +5%. AVEO +4%. GFI +3%. VALE +2%.
    After-hours top losers: SFUN -6%. OTCPK:IMUC -3%. CPWR -3%. LSE -3%. ROC -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • CPWR

    Compuware (NASDAQ:CPWR) has resumed trading and is currently changing hands at $11.40, down 5.2%...

    Compuware (NASDAQ:CPWR) has resumed trading and is currently changing hands at $11.40, down 5.2% AH. Shares are still up 5% YTD thanks to M&A hopes. (FQ4 warning: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • CPWR

    More on Compuware: The FQ4 (March quarter) guidance is below a consensus of $272.8M and $0.15....

    More on Compuware: The FQ4 (March quarter) guidance is below a consensus of $272.8M and $0.15. Compuware blames deal push-outs caused by the failure of many clients/prospects to formalize IT budgets. Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 4:30PM ET. Will the news affect the price P-E suitors are willing to pay for the company? (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ROYL

    Thinly traded Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +9.4%) is on the rise after confirming a mention in an...

    Thinly traded Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +9.4%) is on the rise after confirming a mention in an article published today in Environment and Energy Publishing, which describes Great Bear Petroleum's big bet that Alaska's North Slope will yield bountiful untapped resources as vast as Eagle Ford and Bakken shale fields. ROYL owns 100K acres near Great Bear's operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (AYI +5.4%) trades up after beating on its FQ2 earnings report this morning. Net...

    Acuity Brands (AYI +5.4%) trades up after beating on its FQ2 earnings report this morning. Net earnings rose 27% Y/Y as sales volumes for the lighting-fixtures maker increased. The company also said that third-party forecasts and leading indicators suggest the North American lighting market, which includes renovation and relight activity, will improve during the remainder of FY13. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Recent asset sales (I, II) by Magnum Hunter (MHR +3.9%) and Quicksilver Resources (KWK +2.9%)...

    Recent asset sales (I, II) by Magnum Hunter (MHR +3.9%) and Quicksilver Resources (KWK +2.9%) are just the beginning, as drillers reach a point where their cash flow isn't enough to pay down big debts racked up in the shale land grab. The combined long-term debt for 85 small and midsize U.S. drillers was more than $130B at the end of Q3 2012, according to one estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • MHK

    Mohawk Industries (MHK -2.2%) says that it's completed the acquisition of the ceramic tile...

    Mohawk Industries (MHK -2.2%) says that it's completed the acquisition of the ceramic tile manufacturer Marazzi Group for approximately $1.5B with a combination of cash and equity. The purchase gives MHK a leading position in worldwide ceramic tile, as Marazzi operates manufacturing facilities throughout Russia, the U.S. and Western Europe and sells to more than 100 countries around the world.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX -2.2%) dips after Credit Suisse analyst Bruce Nudell cut the shares from...

    Boston Scientific (BSX -2.2%) dips after Credit Suisse analyst Bruce Nudell cut the shares from Outperform to Neutral on valuation earlier today. In his report, Nudell notes that while he doesn't see its current valuation as overstretched, the shares are now within 8% of his target price and with elevated expectations from the Street already priced in, the stock no longer has enough upside to warrant the higher rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • P

    Pandora's (P -1.9%) share of U.S. radio listening fell to 8.05% in March from 8.48% in February,...

    Pandora's (P -1.9%) share of U.S. radio listening fell to 8.05% in March from 8.48% in February, according to its March audience metrics. Though March appears a seasonally weak month for market share, Pandora's share was nearly unchanged on a M/M basis a year ago (5.73% vs. 5.74%). On a Y/Y basis, growth still looks healthy: listener hours rose 40% Y/Y to 1.49B, and active listeners 36% to 69.5M. (February metrics)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • CP

    A Canadian Pacific (CP -2.8%) freight train derailed this morning in Ontario, and one of the 22...

    A Canadian Pacific (CP -2.8%) freight train derailed this morning in Ontario, and one of the 22 cars affected reportedly is leaking crude oil. The incident comes a week after a CP train derailed in Minnesota, spilling an 20K-30K gallons of oil.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAY

    A management shakeup can't save VeriFone (PAY -2.1%) from secular trends, argues Deutsche while...

    A management shakeup can't save VeriFone (PAY -2.1%) from secular trends, argues Deutsche while reiterating a Sell. "With numerous competitors entering the payment sector (either bypassing hardware or giving it away for free), we believe market share losses, pricing pressure, and extended upgrade cycles, will all [cause] significant challenges to PAY," writes analyst Bryan Keane. He also sees the rise of mobile point-of-sale/dongle solutions (such as Square) likely affecting VeriFone's growth, particularly in emerging markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • PRIM

    Primoris Services (PRIM -2.2%) slips today, despite saying it's received another hefty load of...

    Primoris Services (PRIM -2.2%) slips today, despite saying it's received another hefty load of new contract work totaling $322.7M for the period between January 1 and March 31. The new contracts include power, pipeline, gas utility, water/wastewater, and highway infrastructure projects throughout the U.S. About 38% of the new work will be performed under reimbursable contracts and will not be included in its backlog at the end of the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM

  • Precious metals (GLD -1.4%, SLV -1.3%) tumble to new multi-month lows, with gold at $1,552/oz....

    Precious metals (GLD -1.4%, SLV -1.3%) tumble to new multi-month lows, with gold at $1,552/oz. the weakest since last summer and right near what technicians like to call long-term support going back to mid-2011. At $26.87, silver also threatens key chart levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 24 Comments
  • ZOLT

    Carbon-fiber maker Zoltek (ZOLT +4.2%) trades higher today after confirming that it's launched a...

    Carbon-fiber maker Zoltek (ZOLT +4.2%) trades higher today after confirming that it's launched a process to evaluate strategic alternatives and has engaged JPMorgan as a financial adviser. The move comes in response to pressure from Quintaro Partners, its largest shareholder, who has been pressuring ZOLT's board for changes. Last month, Quintaro requested a special shareholders meeting to discuss the matter, but was rebuffed by the board.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • XSPA

    The Virginia court handling Vringo's (VRNG +5.9%) infringement suit against Google, AOL, IAC,...

    The Virginia court handling Vringo's (VRNG +5.9%) infringement suit against Google, AOL, IAC, Gannett, and Target has ordered the aforementioned companies to respond to Vringo's motion for post-judgment royalties in 15 days. The court has also denied the defendants' renewed motions for Judgment as a Matter of Law on invalidity, non-infringement, and damages or a new trial, and denied Vringo's motion for a new trial on the dollar amount of past damages. Shares are trading higher after a halt. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 9 Comments
  • TGT

    Cleveland Research is out with a new note on Target (TGT -1.7%) in which it calls the sales...

    Cleveland Research is out with a new note on Target (TGT -1.7%) in which it calls the sales trends of the retailer disappointing in Q1 and says gross margins could see more pressure from competitive pricing. "For the quarter, we now see some modest downside to comp store sales and earnings expectations." (full research note .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • RDNT

    RadNet (RDNT -1.4%) says it's completed the repricing of its $348.3M existing senior secured...

    RadNet (RDNT -1.4%) says it's completed the repricing of its $348.3M existing senior secured term loan. As part of the transaction, the firm also raised an additional $40M under the same senior secured term loan facility, which were used to repay certain amounts outstanding and to fund fees and expenses. RDNT anticipates that it will save around $5M in annual interest expense as a result of the lower pricing, and will give it more liquidity in which to grow the business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • KATE

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP +6%) move higher with reports out indicating the retailer is...

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP +6%) move higher with reports out indicating the retailer is exploring selling its Lucky Brand and Juicy Couture brands. A review of the books of the two brands by potential buyers is expected to commence this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • CRR

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -2.6%) slips today after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a cautious...

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -2.6%) slips today after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a cautious Neutral rating and $110 price target. Goldman says the company, which primarily manufactures ceramic proppant used to keep fractures open in oil/gas wells, is faced with a challenging environment where drillers are focusing on cost controls, and normalizing oil/gas prices are driving a preference near-term for cheaper sand over ceramics.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • OMN

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -4.8%) slips after posting a mixed FQ1 report earlier today, beating on...

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -4.8%) slips after posting a mixed FQ1 report earlier today, beating on the top line but coming up short on a per share basis. Net earnings swung to a loss as the building-materials maker reported lower sales from its performance chemicals segment. Margins were also squeezed to 19.5% from 22.1%, even as raw material costs declined, due to the lower volumes, reduced pricing and related manufacturing cost absorption.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +4.4%) catches a bid as it files a request for a new infringement trial against...

    VirnetX (VHC +4.4%) catches a bid as it files a request for a new infringement trial against Cisco. The IP holding firm alleges Cisco was guilty of "inappropriate conduct and arguments" during a recently-concluded trial in which a Texas jury found Cisco not guilty of infringement. Shares had plunged to new 52-week lows over the last two days.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -4.8%) is having a rough day after an analyst at Favus Institutional...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -4.8%) is having a rough day after an analyst at Favus Institutional Research said survey data shows the company's leukemia drug Iclusig (Ariad's first product to reach market) may be producing "a much larger-than-expected number of serious side effects" such as pancreatitis, stroke, and non-reversable liver toxicity. When the drug received early approval in December some analysts were surprised to see "liver toxicity" as a possible side effect on the drug's label.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • ATML

    An upgrade to Buy from FBR fails to stop Atmel (ATML -3.6%) from selling off after the chipmaker...

    An upgrade to Buy from FBR fails to stop Atmel (ATML -3.6%) from selling off after the chipmaker announced the resignation of its CFO and favorably narrowed its Q1 guidance. Analyst Christopher Rollans thinks "the Street underestimates all or a portion" of several catalysts, including touch sensor hub opportunities, Galaxy S IV sales, a "cyclical recovery" in the microcontroller market, higher Windows 8 touchscreen attach rates, and growing XSense sensor demand (previous) in 2H. Rivals Synaptics (SYNA -4.7%) and Cypress (CY -1.8%) are also underperforming.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • TAHO

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO +7.9%) rockets higher on news it received the exploitation license from...

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO +7.9%) rockets higher on news it received the exploitation license from Guatemala's Ministry of Energy and Mines for its flagship Escobal project. TAHO says construction activities remain on-budget and on-schedule for mill commissioning in H2 2013 and commercial production in early 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • FLR

    Fluor (FLR -3%) says it' been awarded a five-year operations and maintenance services contract...

    Fluor (FLR -3%) says it' been awarded a five-year operations and maintenance services contract by Arlington Valley Solar Energy, a member of LS Power Group, for its new solar photovoltaic facility in Arizona. The terms weren't disclosed, and the company booked the undisclosed value into its Q1 backlog.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • ORMP

    Oramed Pharmaceuticals (ORMP +1%) gains after receiving approval for a key patent by the...

    Oramed Pharmaceuticals (ORMP +1%) gains after receiving approval for a key patent by the Japanese Patent Office. The patent, which has also been approved in Israel and Australia, is titled "Methods and Compositions for Oral Administrations of Proteins," and covers a core concept of the company's technology. ORMP's portfolio now consists of seven issued patents with 28 patents pending.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +12.5%) gets a pop from RBC today, who initiated coverage with an...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +12.5%) gets a pop from RBC today, who initiated coverage with an Outperform and a $9 price target, calling it an "undiscovered gem." The firm says the ASTX could have a blockbuster in its pipeline with its experimental blood cancer drug, SGI-110, which is thought to be a safer and more effective version of an already approved therapy it licenses to Eisai (OTCPK:ESALY) and JNJ. ASTX owns all the rights to SGI-110, giving it big upside potential if it gets approved. Additionally, the company reported earlier that it plans to present "significant data" at the AACR annual meeting on Saturday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • VLO

    Looks like another bad day for refiners on fears of increased costs from tougher standards on...

    Looks like another bad day for refiners on fears of increased costs from tougher standards on gasoline, even as BAML says yesterday's selloff of Valero (VLO -4.8%) was overdone. WNR -7.6%, PSX -6.9%, MPC -6.2%, ALJ -6.1%, NTI -5.3%, TSO -4.7%, HFC -4.7%. CVR Refining (CVRR -1.5%) is lower even after announcing estimated costs to meet Tier 3 standards are less than $20M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 21 Comments
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) cut their daily loss after Carl Icahn tells CNBC he hasn't sold a...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) cut their daily loss after Carl Icahn tells CNBC he hasn't sold a single share since buying. It's a nice bit of news for investors with Icahn sitting on substantial profits from his NFLX bet.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • UNXL

    After selling off sharply over the last few trading days, UniPixel (UNXL +18.2%) is skyrocketing...

    After selling off sharply over the last few trading days, UniPixel (UNXL +18.2%) is skyrocketing today. Yesterday evening, SA contributor Ivan Jimenez argued both UniPixel's UniBoss metal touch sensor tech and rival Atmel's (ATML -1.1%) XSense sensors have the potential to take share from traditional ITO sensors: UniBoss is seen having an edge in price, and XSense in transparency and thickness. 44% of UniPixel's float was shorted as of March 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 10 Comments
  • KZIA

    Australia-based biotech Novogen (NVGN +36.7%) soars after the company reports positive data from...

    Australia-based biotech Novogen (NVGN +36.7%) soars after the company reports positive data from a study of its CS-6 drug for ovarian cancer. The company claims CS-6 proved "highly cytotoxic against all cancer stem cell lines tested with the cytotoxicity evident as early as 4 hours."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +4%) gives back a little but remains firmly in the green following...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +4%) gives back a little but remains firmly in the green following a +7% run-up during the pre-open session on an earlier upgrade from Piper Jaffray to Overweight. Piper notes that it's channel checks with ER physicians, psychiatrists, and opinion leaders was even more encouraging than it expected on both the near and longer-term market potential for Adasuve versus previous projections. Additionally, it's clinical attributes bode well for a value-added partnership being signed soon to enable effective launch in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • DLTR

    The dollar store group (DLTR, DG, FDO) outperforms broad market averages after Dollar Tree lands...

    The dollar store group (DLTR, DG, FDO) outperforms broad market averages after Dollar Tree lands an upgrade to Outperform from Morgan Stanley. A survey by the investment firm showed the payroll tax hike isn't impacting consumer shopping decisions. What to watch: Dollar stores aren't seeing the same pressure as Wal-Mart as in-store pricing and promotions have helped to protect margins, but will the retailing giant's move to a smaller-store format turn the tables?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • FFIV

    The sell-side continues to turn more positive on F5 (FFIV +2.2%): Craig-Hallum has launched...

    The sell-side continues to turn more positive on F5 (FFIV +2.2%): Craig-Hallum has launched coverage with a Buy and $110 PT today, helping shares rally above $90 in the process. Baird upgraded F5 yesterday, and McAdams Wright a week ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • SWI

    Morgan Stanley upgrades SolarWinds (SWI +1.5%) to Equal Weight, arguing the firm's accelerating...

    Morgan Stanley upgrades SolarWinds (SWI +1.5%) to Equal Weight, arguing the firm's accelerating license volume growth and stabilizing sales productivity justify its current valuation - SolarWinds currently trades at 36x 2013E EPS. Shares aren't too far removed from their 52-week high of $61.52, as investors bet on further systems management software share gains relative to IBM, H-P, CA, and BMC.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CZR

    Casino stocks trade sluggishly as Zynga's push into real-money gaming in the U.K. appears to...

    Casino stocks trade sluggishly as Zynga's push into real-money gaming in the U.K. appears to make it a more formidable threat to the sector. Though nearly all the brick-and-mortar gaming companies are involved in extensive planning for the expected opening up of online gambling in the U.S., pure Internet companies are still set to have lower cost structures and the ability to move more nimbly. Sector watch: Caesers Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) -2.5%, Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) -2.3%, Boyd Gaming (NYSE:BYD) -2.2%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) -2.1%, MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) -2%, Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE +2%) is replacing in-mine trucks with 23 miles of conveyor belts and building a...

    Vale (VALE +2%) is replacing in-mine trucks with 23 miles of conveyor belts and building a second railway through the Amazon to cut costs at its Serra Sul project, part of the Carajas mining complex in Brazil which is the industry’s most expensive project ever at ~$20B. The project will allow Vale to reduce mine-to-port costs at Carajas to ~$15/ton, half the company’s current operational cost.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -5.9%) turn lower on heavy volume. CEO Reed Hastings didn't post...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -5.9%) turn lower on heavy volume. CEO Reed Hastings didn't post anything negative on Facebook - although the SEC says it's now OK if he wants to use social media to make announcements - instead the breakdown is being attributed to technical and momentum factors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (GFI -1.9%) says employees at its Tarkwa and Damang mines in Ghana have...

    Gold Fields (GFI -1.9%) says employees at its Tarkwaand Damangmines in Ghana have embarked on illegal strikes that have halted production at both mines. GFI says it is analyzing and investigating the miners' demands but appeals to employees to maintain law and order. Most big miners are up in early trading: AEM +0.9%, AUY +0.8%, NEM +0.5%, GG +0.2%. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +12.4%) rips higher as its first real-money gambling titles go live in the U.K. two...

    Zynga (ZNGA +12.4%) rips higher as its first real-money gambling titles go live in the U.K. two months ahead of schedule. It doesn't hurt that 17.8% of the float was shorted as of March 15. TechCrunch observes Zynga is accepting payments in U.S. dollars, Canadian dollars, euros, and yen (in addition to pounds), perhaps setting the stage for fast international expansion. "Our long term vision is to offer ... real money games on multiple platforms in regulated markets worldwide," Zynga states, while promising U.K. Facebook/mobile launches later this year. GLUU +2.9%. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • BWLD

    Raymond James is doing wonders for the restaurant sector with a number of upgrades that are...

    Raymond James is doing wonders for the restaurant sector with a number of upgrades that are helping light a fire under shares. Lower commodity prices and indications of a bounce in QSR spending look good enough to the firm for it to take its foot off the brakes. Upgrades: Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +3.5%) to Strong Buy from Market Perform; Panera Bread (PNRA +3.9%) to Market Perform; Chipotle (CMG +1.2%) to Market Perform from Underperform; Brinker International (EAT +2.6%) to Outperform from Market Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS +25.6%) rises after saying it has signed a development agreement with a...

    Microvision (MVIS +25.6%) rises after saying it has signed a development agreement with a "prominent electronics company" for the supply of patented PicoP technology for use in a new display engine. The company says it will receive $4.6M in fees over the next 13 months in connection with the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +10.5%) plans to present "significant data supporting our clinical...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +10.5%) plans to present "significant data supporting our clinical programs" at the American Association for Cancer Research's (AACR) annual meeting, which starts on Saturday. Astex is due to present preliminary Phase II data for SGI-110, an agent that's being developed for treating cancer. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • MSPD

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) -20.3% after warning it expects FQ2 (March quarter) revenue of...

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) -20.3% after warning it expects FQ2 (March quarter) revenue of $35.1M-$35.5M, below a consensus of $38.3M and prior guidance of $37.6M-$39.2M. Moreover, based on "early indications," Mindspeed expects FQ3 revenue to be flat Q/Q; the consensus is for sales to grow to $40.3M. The chipmaker blames weaker-than-expected 3G small cell base station cells for the FQ2 shortfall, while adding 4G small cell sales are believed to have roughly doubled Q/Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • NKA

    Niska Gas Storage (NYSE:NKA) +3.9% premarket after announcing an equity restructuring...

    Niska Gas Storage (NYSE:NKA) +3.9% premarket after announcing an equity restructuring eliminating its subordinated units which accounted for 50% of units outstanding. Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold, believing the change in the capital structure places NKA in a position to begin growing its distribution. Since coming public in May 2010, NKA has paid only the minimum quarterly distribution.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CONN

    Shares of Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN) shoot up 13.2% in premarket trading after the retailer's plan to...

    Shares of Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN) shoot up 13.2% in premarket trading after the retailer's plan to move away from electronics to sell more furniture and appliances starts to add to its bottom line. The company also lifted its FY14 EPS guidance to above consensus estimates. RadioShack (NYSE:RSH), are you listening?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures pare small earlier gains to trade flat after the ADP jobs report...

    Market preview: Stock futures pare small earlier gains to trade flat after the ADP jobs report missed forecasts and as investors remain wary ahead of nonfarm payrolls on Friday. With the S&P Mini at 1564.75, the index remains tantalizingly close to its all-time record of 1,576.09 - as it has done for the past few sessions. Zynga zings 12% after saying it will offer gambling products in Britain, but ConAgra drops 2.2% following its earnings. Later: ISM Non-Manufacturing Index, Fed's Williams.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ORAN

    France Telecom (FTE) -3.5% to $9.83 after UBS downgrades shares to Sell. FTE is now within...

    France Telecom (FTE) -3.5% to $9.83 after UBS downgrades shares to Sell. FTE is now within striking distance of its 52-week low of $9.46.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 4 Comments
  • CALL

    Premarket gainers: CALL +14%. CONN +10%. ZNGA +10%. ASTX +10%. UNXL +9%. AWRE +9%. OMPI +9%....

    Premarket gainers: CALL +14%. CONN +10%. ZNGA +10%. ASTX +10%. UNXL +9%. AWRE +9%. OMPI +9%. NVAX +9%. ALXA +8%. MHR +7%. NFX +6%.
    Losers: MSPD -19%. GPN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARCC

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) prices its 16.65M share secondary at an undisclosed price, but the...

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) prices its 16.65M share secondary at an undisclosed price, but the shares are -2.4% premarket to $17.58, giving a fairly good idea. The underwriters retain an option to purchase about 2.5M more shares. Together with the option (should it be exercised), the offering adds about 7.6% to the float. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • MTP

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +4.1%) signs an agreement with pharmacy benefit manager Prime...

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +4.1%) signs an agreement with pharmacy benefit manager Prime Therapeutics for the latter to distribute Dara's Gelclair bioadhesive pain-relieving gel for patients with oral mucositis (OOM) and its Soltamox oral solution for breast-cancer patients. OM is inflammation and ulceration in the mouth and is common in patients undergoing chemotherapy and radiotherapy. (PR)

    Bidding war on: Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) increases its offer for Obagi Medical...

    Bidding war on: Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) increases its offer for Obagi Medical (NASDAQ:OMPI) to $24 a share in cash, a day after Merz Pharmaceuticals proposed $22. That bid had trumped Valeant's original offer of $19.75. Obagi has accepted Valeant's new proposal, which has sent the former's shares up 8.4% to $24.80.

    More on ConAgra's (NYSE:CAG) FQ3: The company's Consumer Foods segment saw sales increase 7% Y/Y...

    More on ConAgra's (NYSE:CAG) FQ3: The company's Consumer Foods segment saw sales increase 7% Y/Y to $2.30B with acquisitions, pricing, and product mix helping to make up for a decline in organic volume. Sales for the Commercial Foods segment rose 1% to $1.256B with market conditions turning toward ConAgra's favor. The company reaffirms FY13 EPS of $2.15, in-line with consensus. CAG -2.4% premarket. (PR)

  • Japanese shares rebound sharply from losses yesterday in an otherwise fairly calm day for Asian...

    Japanese shares rebound sharply from losses yesterday in an otherwise fairly calm day for Asian stocks, with the falling yen and strong March U.S. sales for Japanese car companies helping to boost sentiment in Tokyo. The rise in shares comes as the BOJ holds Governor Haruhiko Kuroda's first policy meeting. Chinese shares edge up ahead of a four-day weekend. Japan +2.5%, Hong Kong flat, China +0.2%, India -0.3%.
